body_html:
I think that we can restore a tfslim model meta and checkpoint using:

new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph(<meta_graph>)
new_saver.restore(sess, <checkpoint>)

But after notebook uses

tf.import_graph_def(graph_def, {'input':t_preprocessed})

I've tryied to substitute with

tf.import_graph_def(graph.as_graph_def(), {'distort_image/ExpandDims':t_preprocessed})

to maintain the next cells code and change only layers names in the notebook but I think that it is not the right way to do it.
body_text:
I think that we can restore a tfslim model meta and checkpoint using:
new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph(<meta_graph>)
new_saver.restore(sess, <checkpoint>)

But after notebook uses
tf.import_graph_def(graph_def, {'input':t_preprocessed})

I've tryied to substitute with
tf.import_graph_def(graph.as_graph_def(), {'distort_image/ExpandDims':t_preprocessed})

to maintain the next cells code and change only layers names in the notebook but I think that it is not the right way to do it.
body:
I think that we can restore a tfslim model meta and checkpoint using:

```
new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph(<meta_graph>)
new_saver.restore(sess, <checkpoint>)
```

But after notebook uses 

```
tf.import_graph_def(graph_def, {'input':t_preprocessed})
```

I've tryied to substitute with

```
tf.import_graph_def(graph.as_graph_def(), {'distort_image/ExpandDims':t_preprocessed})
```

to maintain the next cells code and change only layers names in the notebook but I think that it is not the right way to do it.
